title: Rick Astley downs shots with stunned Holly and Phil as part of bizarre ritual
text:

Rick Astley stunned Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby today by downing shots live on This Morning.

The Never Gonna Give You Up singer brought Jäger into the studio - with Phil and Holly's faces on the bottle.

Holly cried out in shock when Rick, who had provided the refreshments, took a shot before his interview had even begun.

Rick explained that it was actually part of a serious ritual he does before any TV or radio interview.

Part of the tradition is making everyone else in the room join in, so Phil racked up some shots for the three of them.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Rick revealed that he would love to play at Glastonbury but had never been asked, so they said 'cheers' to getting him a slot at the festival.

"Lovely," said Phil after getting the booze down the hatch, while Holly pulled a face.

Rick admitted he was shocked the This Morning hosts actually "necked" the alcohol and there was no sipping.

Giggling Phil replied: "Don't you know us at all?"

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Just before they did the shots, Rick explained why he does one before he is interviewed.

He said: "I think we were in Germnay doing a gig one time and there was nothing to do a drink of. And we like to have a shot before we go on.

"There was some Jäger and we had a shot and it was the best gig we’ve done. A really amazing gig.

"So we got into this superstition of we’ve got to have a Jäger literally every breakfast radio, TV, everything we've done."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

The ritual almost cost an intern his job once when they were in America.

The runner thought that he was going to be fired for doing a shot with the singer.

Rick said: "We made him have one with us. If you’re in the room you have to have one."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

This Morning viewers took to Twitter after watching the trio do shots on air.

One fan said: "Rick Astley doing a shot of Jäger on #ThisMorning is my spirit animal"

"Rick Ashley giving zero f***s about being live on TV," added another.

A third said: "Why do they drink so much when they're supposed to be working?"

*This Morning airs weekdays on ITV at 10.30am
description: The Never Gonna Give You Up singer brought Jäger on This Morning as part of a tradition he does before every interview
